title: A much improved Astrid app
comment: Ever since Astrid got shutdown by Yahoo, I have been on the hunt for a good to do app. While a lot of other apps provide other features, Astrid provided a very clean UI and an awesome widget. This app takes all the best qualities of Astrid and improves upon them. My only problem is that the font color of the list items in the transparent widget is grey. Due to this, it appears very washed out in both dark screens and light screens. If you guys could make it white, it would vastly improve the readability.
Thanks for the feedback. If you create a new widget and select both transparent background and dark theme then it should have white text. Email support@tasks.org if you have any questions

This app really helps keep me on track and feel like I'm not forgetting to do things. I've added in all the recurring things I have to do and it just reminds me when it's time! So far, it does a great job reminding me to take out the trash on trash day, change the sheets, take my medicine, and even things that recur less frequently, like paying the car insurance bill and using a new toothbrush (which you're supposed to do every three months, but I would never remember if I didn't have the app remind me).

title: Liked it.
comment: *Edit: The bug has been fixed. Thank you. Later I'll bring some suggestions for the app. Jesus loves you.

Absolutely Amazing!  Love everything about it!

title: Epic.

Hey Mark - can you e-mail support@tasks.org to discuss your issues. Thanks

title: Love it!
comment: I am terrible at remembering things. This app helps a ton. One of my favorite features is that the notification cannot be canceled accidentally by clearing your notifications. It stays there until you snooze it or complete it.

title: Need nothing else
comment: This is fantastic app. I first used it three years ago when it was Astrid. I still use it as my "to do" and reminder app. I like that it works seamlessly with my Google calendar. I can add to my list on my phone during meetings or while traveling. Then when I get to the office I pull up the task module in Gmail and then I can print the list, or schedule events, prioritize, etc. I've tried several similar apps but I have not found any that out perform this one.

title: Excellent
comment: Best To Do list I've found.  Voice recognition works like a charm.  Never forget another task with this app.

title: Great App,  lot of features
comment: GUI skins would be a nice option.

Latest update - according to Google Play - doesn't just want access to Location info (as explained, thanks Alex) but also In-app purchases, Identity, Calendar, Contacts, Phone, Photos/Media/Files, Microphone and Device ID & call information.  I'm not paranoid, but I do worry a lot about data-mining creep.  Given you extra stars for your quick reply to my initial concerns, thank you :-) (Later....) I have now read your reassurances in the READ MORE section on the phone, have installed the update. Though it is odd that the huge list of apparently new permissions suddenly appeared with this update. All stars reinstated.

Hey Patricia - the latest update adds location based reminders and needs access to location services. I posted a privacy policy at http://tasks.org/privacy.html. A version without location reminders can be installed from the F-Droid repository (https://f-droid.org/wiki/page/org.tasks)

title: Very helpful
comment: Keeps me organized, very easy to use

title: Thank god Astrid-like is back

title: Awesome
comment: Best open source task app.

title: Great!
comment: Does what I need it to. But still I would like to see a better looking widget.

title: Completed tasks support incomplete
comment: Great dev responds fast! Support for seeing completed tasks seemed incomplete and only available via sort on one screen.   Glad it was added.  Now just need to work the kinks out and I can switch to this from another app.  Been wanting to use this for a long time.

Hey Monty - google tasks paginates results and the app doesn't support this yet, so it can only grab 100 updates per list at a time. If a list has more than 100 tasks (including completed) the initial sync will be incomplete.  Email support@tasks.org if you have any questions

title: Happy!

title: Immediate issue
comment: I just installed the app yesterday (former Astrid user). First thing I noticed is that the app always opens/defaults to MY Tasks - even when I previously closed with TODAY'S Tasks and today's tasks are all I want to see. Thank you!
Hey Jake - I plan to address this but in the meantime you can create a shortcut or widget for the 'Today' list and the app will launch to that list. Email support@tasks.org if you have any questions

title: Simplistic, Efficient, and Effective
comment: It works really great and is fast, easy to use and organized. The interface is simple and reminds me of the old planner I used that came with my old phone except this has some additional features that make it more better. It can even connect to gmail for the tasks to be sent to your calendar too. The reminders have snooze options and are set to stay unless specifically chosen not to which is great motivation to finish the task and not put it off. Also, there's no spam of advertisements either.
You can't mass add items. One at a time, then back to the list. Very inconvenient.

title: Excellent
comment: Very usefull

title: Nicely done

title: Two issues with this app
comment: 1. No batch mode for creating tasks or subtasks 2. When creating a task in the My Tasks (aka all tasks) tab, I don't get the option to select a list that I already have created, to add the task too. Instead I have to create the list inside the new task and next thing I know I have two of the same lists. Or I have to make sure I'm not in the My Tasks tab and be in the tab that I want to add the task to. This is frustrating when I'm at work and in a hurry..
Hey Nik - I plan to add an option to select a google task list from the task edit screen in a future update

Suggestions: 1) I disagree with right aligning the dates, I think they are more readable where they are. Perhaps select position via a preference setting? 2) Could there be a way from a category view to tick several items from the master list for inclusion in that category?
What a great app !!!

title: Yahoo ruined my life. 😜

comment: Need help- is there a way to select several tasks on the list, then change the due date? I have to update each of yesterday's tasks each time to move them to today (or tomorrow, or next June 30, or whatever)-  many thanks for *the best* task app out there!

I would like to suggest an improvement for the notifications: usually I don't need a notification right when the task is due, but some time before that, like 15 minutes. It would be great when one would not have to enter the date and time for an additional alarm to be notified before the due time, but simply by choosing how many minutes before the due time. Thanks

title: Looks nice, no android Wear notification support
comment: Android Wear notification actions are a must for modern apps. I need to be able to instantly snooze for customisable amounts of time in settings. Snoozing may be atrocious, but as the dev's reply states, it is functional for very basic usage, however that does not include marking tasks as complete since there are no notification actions. Also, some devices hide duplicate notifications and this app doesn't make sure that notifications aren't duplicates.

Hey Joshua - The app will re-remind you when a task is due if you have 'overdue' or random reminders set, however it shouldn't create a second reminder. You should also be able to complete a task from your watch as long as you haven't disabled notification actions from the app settings menu. I plan on adding the ability to snooze from your watch.

title: Well thought out, intuitive to-do list
comment: One of the few to-do apps that doesn't have annoying headings like Today, Tomorrow, Next Week, etc. which just reduce available screen space. A few suggestions: 1) Right adjust the date below the task name - it will improve readability of both the tasks and the dates. Or pref have task and date on one line. 2) Use a consistent date format (e.g. Wed 23 Apr). It's a mess at present with day/month, days of the week and the abbreviations yest, Today & tmrw. 3) Make notification sounds optional, as with vibrate.

Thanks for the feedback. You can choose 'Silent' as a ringtone from the notification preferences. I do plan to address #2 and I will take #1 into consideration when I am updating the task list screen in the near future.

title: Awesome

I know it can be dragged and dropped to the bottom but it would be better if it comes at the bottom automatically.

title: Great app, great design

title: Almost perfect
comment: I really like the Astrid To-Do List, but like all the task lists I've tried it lacks a location feature. Not a tag that will remind you when you're near the location, but simply a location tag as the Google Calendar have, that allows you to set the location where the task will be performed. In example:  List of restaurants to check: - Restaurant A - Restaurant B  If there was a location attribute I could easily put the restaurants address and manage to navigate to my GPS Application. I made an example with Restaurants to check, but it's also useful with a large number of to do's. With this improvement it would be 5 stars to me, nevertheless is an amazing application.

title: Really like this app seems to be everything I need from a Google task manager

title: Replacing another "Tasks" program I've been using for years!

Second, show task list name clearly in upper left ("Google Tasks:" not necessary info here). Third, allow swiping screen left and right to move from one list to another. Love your app!

title: Just what I was looking for

title: So close; missing important features
comment: It was a close toss-up between this app and GTasks, but I ended up with GTasks because Tasks: ATDLC is missing some key features that are important to me: * Tasks sync between devices, but notifications don't. If I set a reminder on a task on my phone, the task appears on my tablet with the due date but no reminder. * The categories appear to be internal to Tasks, not to Google Tasks. When I sync'ed my tasks from Google, I could see the categories in the left-hand menu, but there doesn't appear to be a way to change them or add new tasks to the existing categories. * Recurring tasks (as has been noted) don't sync across devices. GTasks can do this; what's keeping Tasks from doing the same thing? * I realize Tasks is open-source and free, so I expect a little less "polish" than paid apps, but the old Android v2 settings menu is kind of jarring. I applaud Tasks and hope to see more improvements as time goes on, but right now GTasks is slightly superior.

I have a brain injury and Astrid was the only tool I ever found (other tthan the long gone ECCO Pro) that could help me see things in a way that I could plan and get things done .  My life was devastated when it was discontinued, and I literally could not function.  I have a feature request that I know would help me a lot, and would probably be useful to others as well.   I used to color code the lists (green for financial, red for medical, etc) and these color tags would appear next to each task. This was a big help to me in visualizing the big picture.  It would help even more if the task names themselves were color coded in some way, perhaps by the color of the first list they were entered on. comment: Astrid was my favorite apps on Android, but Yahoo kills it just like before. (e.g. briefcase, flickr, ... etc) Thanks for your great work to continue its life. I hope you can make it better and better.  THANKS AGAIN!

title: Missing content...
comment: There is still some tweeking todo, (pardon the pun).  The check off blocks are missing from the widget. They were in the original. There is only one widget to select from, even though it is expandable on my 10.1 tablet.    The lines seperating the tasks, in the dark mode, are a nice touch.  The ability to import the backup files from the original was also well received.

title: Love it
comment: Great, just what I needed.

title: The best....
comment: As good as it gets.

title: Best simple shared task list
comment: We use this to coordinate shopping lists, To-Do lists, gift lists, and several other important lists between our household members.  I created a new Google account to host the lists.  Next, add the account to all phones, then select sync Calendar (in Android settings) for that account,and select that account in the Tasks app.  All task lists for that common account are then available and sync'd.  This is an essential app!

title: Lovely tasks app
comment: I'm really liking the app. There's a lot of configuration to do and I was able to set it up almost like I wanted it. It's easy to use and very intuative. I like being able to add priorities to tasks, without adding dates and vice versa. The only think that needs work is the widget:  I'd like to be able add a little space between tasks, as it is a little clustered as of now. Checking off tasks in the widget would also be a very welcome addition and one I feel is lacking right now. Overall it's a great app, but there is room for improvement. Would gladly pay for a premium edition (not a subscription).

title: Decent Replacement
comment: It's a decent app and one of the better Astrid replacements. The only thing that could make this  a definite 5-star is to be able to sync and use multiple accounts.

title: Better job than astrid ever did!
comment: Awesome app! Thanks for picking up the torch and running with it!

title: Great program
comment: You are the best.  This is a great alternative to Astrid shutdown and I'm sure will only get better!!  A 2x3 and 4x4 widget please.  Also, to be able to swipe between lists.  I'm sure there are a couple of other things that needs added but with time I'm sure it will come. Thnaks so much!

title: Wonderful tasking app
comment: This is a great continuation of astrid. Great improvements and I am glad to see this code has not died off for good after astrid shutdown.

title: Sad Face
comment: The transparent theme has been removed in the latest update.
Sorry, I do plan to bring a transparent background back in a new widget. Send me an e-mail if you would like to discuss it some more.

title: Simple to use, efficient, has everything i need
comment: The best to do app which i have used ever! Would upgrade to 5 stars once the web version is up.
Amazing app, use it throughout the day

title: Excellent tribute
comment: Loving that it can sync with Google tasks and the uncluttered interface.

title: Even better..
comment: ..than Astrid was?!  WAY less lag time.  Nice job!

title: Absolutely great
comment: I can't say enough good about Tasks. As a former Astrid user I found that the competition falls short in a lot of ways, especially when it comes to repeating tasks.

title: Amazing!
comment: I was using TickTick as an alternative to Astrid, but it completely sucks. The last 2-3 updates contained only bug fixes-no useful features. They are not even trying to be successful. Anyway, I dropped TickTick like a bag of rocks and switched to Tasks immediately. It is basically Astrid. Not sure how this is possible. Very happy again.
Thanks for re-creating "astrid"

title: Finally best tasks app hands down is back !!
comment: This is the only Tasks app which handles due dates and reminders separately . It needs more reviewers !! Any.Do looks really nice, but fails in managing reminders. Here you can set a due date and reminders 2 or 3 days before the task is due !!

title: Two words: Tasker Plugin!
comment: The incredibly versatile context based reminders made possible with this combination was the #1 thing that made Astrid so good.

title: Not bad but....
comment: ....needs scrollable widget.

title: Really like this app!
comment: The feature I really appreciate is being able to set custom recurrence intervals.
A simple task management app that does everything I need it to do.

title: Must have app !!!
comment: Very easy to use !!! Great app... I highly recommend everyone to download this who want to manage their to do tasks easily. i love the way this app gives Notifications... kudos to the developers... hats off guyz...  Thank you... !!!

title: Far better than Any.Do
comment: Thanks to the developer for reviving Astrid-like tasks. Interface is perfect and familiar. Most of all, we have the random reminders back. Why developers can't see the value of those is beyond me. I have been lost without them. Perfect for tasks that can't be timed but that you do not want to forget. Great for those of us who don't have time to open the app during the day to see what has to be done.

title: Awesome!
comment: I was bummed that after Astrid shut down, I couldn't find any decent replacements. I tried Any.do, Wunderlist, etc., but found them all lacking in one way or another.  While I didn't think of Astrid as the best todo list out there, I realized how much I missed its configurability and features. Something as simple as snoozing reminders is something other apps seem to do poorly.  Tasks, being a near-replica of Astrid was a god-send! The fact that it's open-source was a very welcome surprise! Good job, Alex and the Tasks team!

title: Very useful
comment: I replaced my other to do app with this one. It's working well for me because it's tailored to remind you consistently on how much you wanted ti be snooze and the like. Thanks.

title: Change the icon to a flat one.
comment: Sticks out like a sore thumb.
Thanks for the feedback. I'm trying to find someone who can make a better icon than I can.

title: Любимый Астрид :)
comment: Спасибо! Если бы еще GTD принципы сделать... Купил бы

title: A good work in progress!
comment: This is amazing! Astrid will be missed but I'm happy to see this come to life! I am going to join the dev team and the alpha testers! I can't wait till there's a account sync for multiple devices and a web interface    THANK YOU!
Great, send me an e-mail when you get a chance

title: Go tasks!!!
comment: I'm a big fan of Astrid, so, welcome again! The Best tasks app... Congrats to Alex.... Keep going!

title: astrid 할일 어플 서비스가 종료되었는데
comment: 다른 일정 어플로 갈아타려니 맘에 드는게 없었습니다. 그런데 이름만 바뀌고 기능이 동일한 이 어플을 발견했어요. 야후랑 인수합병 되면서 서비스가 종료되었는데 개발자분이 이름만 바꿔서 다시 업로드해주신 것 같네요. 이거만한 일정관리 어플이 없습니다. 진짜 최고

title: Astrid RIP.... Hello Tasks!
comment: Still the best task app on Play. Lets see what Alex comes up with in future updates.
